intro: Ranunculus hollianus, commonly known as the Christmas ranunculus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its delicate, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features palmately lobed leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
